question_stem.en: An autopsy is being performed on a 72-year-old man with a history of myocardial infarction. Light microscopy of a portion of the left ventricle reveals the findings shown in the image below: {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 对一名有心肌梗死病史的 72 岁男性进行尸检。左心室一部分的显微镜检查显示如下图像所示的发现：{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: This patient most likely sustained the myocardial infarction during which of the following time frames prior to his death?
question.zh: 该患者最有可能在死亡前的以下哪个时间段内发生了心肌梗死？

explanation.en:
Postmortem histopathology of this patient's myocardium reveals a dense neutrophilic infiltrate surrounded by relatively normal myocytes consistent with the morphologic changes expected in the border zone of ischemic injury 1-3 days after myocardial infarction (MI). Myocardial cells are highly metabolically active and susceptible to ischemic injury after as little as 3–4 minutes of oxygen deprivation due to coronary artery blockage.

After irreversible myocardial injury, a series of characteristic microscopic changes occur over predictable time frames due to coagulation necrosis of myocardial fibers and infiltration of inflammatory cells, which play an essential role in the healing process:

•	During the first 4 hours post-MI, no visible change occurs although cardiac-specific enzymes can be detected in the patient's bloodstream (Choice A).
•	From 4 to 24 hours post-MI, changes due to digestion of cytoplasmic organelles, denaturation of proteins, and loss of RNA become visible (eg, wavy, hypereosinophilic myocytes with shrunken nuclei), especially in the central portion of the infarct.
•	From 1 to 3 days post-MI, neutrophils infiltrate the border zone of the injured tissue in response to proinflammatory cytokines (eg, IL-6, IL-8), eventually migrating to the central portion of the infarct. These neutrophils phagocytize dead myocytes and release lysosomal enzymes, reactive oxygen species, and cytokines (eg, IL-1, TNF-α) that can prevent infiltration by pathogens and facilitate wound healing.
•	From 3 to 10 days post-MI, macrophages infiltrate and phagocytize dead myocytes and neutrophils while initiating the formation of granulation tissue by producing cytokines (eg, IL-10) and growth factors (TGF-β) (Choice C).
•	From 10 to 14 days post-MI, prominent fibroblast proliferation, collagen deposition, and neovascularization of granulation tissue are present.
•	From 2 weeks to 2 months post-MI, collagen remodeling and fibroblast differentiation into myofibroblasts drive the formation of scar tissue (Choice D).
•	After 2 months post-MI, remodeling continues to a slower rate as the scar matures and contracts (Choice E).

Educational objective:
Irreversible myocardial ischemic injury initiates a series of predictable morphologic changes over the hours to weeks after the initial injury. From 1 and 3 days after the initial injury, neutrophils infiltrate the border zone of the injured tissue (where myocytes are relatively normal) in response to proinflammatory cytokines (eg, IL-6, IL-8), eventually migrating to the central portion of the infarct. {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}}
explanation.zh:
该患者的心肌尸检组织病理学显示，在相对正常的心肌细胞周围有密集的嗜中性粒细胞浸润，这与心肌梗死（MI）后 1-3 天缺血性损伤边界区的形态学变化一致。心肌细胞代谢活性很高，在冠状动脉阻塞导致缺氧 3-4 分钟后，就容易受到缺血性损伤。

不可逆的心肌损伤发生后，由于心肌纤维的凝固性坏死和炎症细胞的浸润，会发生一系列可预测时间范围内的特征性微观变化，这些变化在愈合过程中起着至关重要的作用：

•	在 MI 后的最初 4 小时内，尽管可以在患者的血液中检测到心脏特异性酶，但没有可见的变化（选项 A）。
•	在 MI 后 4 到 24 小时内，由于细胞质细胞器的消化、蛋白质变性和 RNA 丢失，变化变得可见（例如，波浪状、嗜酸性肌细胞伴有核缩小），尤其是在梗死的中心部分。
•	在 MI 后 1 到 3 天内，嗜中性粒细胞响应促炎细胞因子（例如，IL-6、IL-8）浸润到受损组织的边界区，最终迁移到梗死的中心部分。这些嗜中性粒细胞吞噬死亡的心肌细胞并释放溶酶体酶、活性氧和细胞因子（例如，IL-1、TNF-α），这些可以阻止病原体的浸润并促进伤口愈合。
•	在 MI 后 3 到 10 天内，巨噬细胞浸润并吞噬死亡的心肌细胞和嗜中性粒细胞，同时通过产生细胞因子（例如，IL-10）和生长因子（TGF-β）来启动肉芽组织的形成（选项 C）。
•	在 MI 后 10 到 14 天内，肉芽组织中存在明显的成纤维细胞增殖、胶原沉积和新血管形成。
•	在 MI 后 2 周到 2 个月内，胶原重塑和成纤维细胞分化为肌成纤维细胞，驱动疤痕组织的形成（选项 D）。
•	在 MI 后 2 个月后，随着疤痕成熟和收缩，重塑以较慢的速度继续（选项 E）。

教育目标：
不可逆的心肌缺血性损伤会在最初损伤后的数小时到数周内引发一系列可预测的形态学变化。在最初损伤后的 1 到 3 天内，嗜中性粒细胞响应促炎细胞因子（例如，IL-6、IL-8）浸润到受损组织的边界区（肌细胞相对正常），最终迁移到梗死的中心部分。{{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the histological changes that occur in the myocardium following a myocardial infarction at different time points. Specifically, it focuses on the timing of neutrophil infiltration after an MI.

To answer this question, one must recognize the histological features presented in the image (neutrophil infiltration) and correlate them with the corresponding time frame after myocardial infarction. Remembering the sequence of cellular events post-MI is crucial.
summary.zh:
这个问题考察了不同时间点心肌梗死后心肌发生的组织学变化。具体来说，它侧重于 MI 后嗜中性粒细胞浸润的时间。

为了回答这个问题，必须识别图像中显示的组织学特征（嗜中性粒细胞浸润），并将它们与心肌梗死后的相应时间范围相关联。记住 MI 后的细胞事件顺序至关重要。
